alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 4:51PM MST until September 13 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Chevelon Creek and Black Canyon Creek in Coconino County and Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 1100 PM MST Wednesday. * At 443 PM MST, Very heavy rain fell this afternoon in the Black Canyon and Chevelon Canyon drainages from just north of Heber and Aripine westward. Runoff from these storms will flow north along Chevelon Creek to near the confluence with the Little Colorado River through the evening. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen, with localized amounts of 3 to 5 inches. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Heber-Overgaard and Chevelon Crossing Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 377 between mile markers 0 and 8. State Route 277 between mile markers 311 and 317. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Chevelon Canyon, Black Canyon, Day Wash, West Chevelon Canyon, Phoenix Park Wash, Potato Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
